ghostPost.plaintext:
Ghost does not support load-balanced clustering or multi-server setups of any
description, there should only be one  Ghost instance per site. 

The recommended scaling and performance approach is to put a cache and/or CDN in
front of your blog; pages generated by Ghost are essentially static so there
should be very little traffic hitting your Ghost server with a well configured
cache.

Errors
If you try to run Ghost on multiple nodes, you will run into errors such as 
Response code 405 (Method Not Allowed)  - and find that the Ghost service needs
to be constantly restarted for any content to reliably appear.

The correct solution is to reduce your infrastructure to a single node and use
caching.
ghostPost.html:
Ghost does not support load-balanced clustering or multi-server setups of any description, there should only be one Ghost instance per site.

The recommended scaling and performance approach is to put a cache and/or CDN in front of your blog; pages generated by Ghost are essentially static so there should be very little traffic hitting your Ghost server with a well configured cache.

Errors

If you try to run Ghost on multiple nodes, you will run into errors such as Response code 405 (Method Not Allowed) - and find that the Ghost service needs to be constantly restarted for any content to reliably appear.

The correct solution is to reduce your infrastructure to a single node and use caching.
